title: BBC Hull & East Yorkshire Live Friday 4 March - BBC News
summary: man dies in fire on washington street in hull .
owners of north ferriby united put club up for sale .

documents.title: our live coverage for the day
text: live coverage has now finished for the day across hull and east yorkshire .
we 're back on monday morning from 08:00 with more news , sport , travel and weather .
hope you have a good weekend .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: look north headlines
text: here 's what 's coming up on look north with me , peter levy on bbc one from 18:30 :
here 's peter with the latest headlines .
@ twitterid yeeeee , love @ twitterid
author: Peter Levy
Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: headlines : man dies in hull house fire and new jobs secured for the area
text: headlines : man dies in hull house fire and new jobs secured for the area
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: weather : rain and sleet for most this evening
text: a cloudy and wet evening ahead with outbreaks of rain and sleet and perhaps a little snow .
the risk of icy stretches .
here 's the full forecast with keeley
author: Keeley Donovan
BBC Look North

documents.title: breakingman dies in hull house fire
text: a man 's died in a fire on washington street in hull .
humberside fire and rescue were called to the house in the beverley road area of the city in the early hours of this morning .
three people managed to get themselves out of the property .
there was what 's being described as a significant fire in a first floor bedroom where a man was found dead at the scene .
investigations are underway but police are n't treating the fire as sus
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: new green energy plant to create jobs and power 11,000 homes
text: a new £ 35m biomass plant near hull will create forty new jobs .
hrs energy says the site , which will be built in the hamlet of tansterne in east yorkshire , will provide enough energy to power 11,000 homes .
it will burn twenty tonnes of recycled wood an hour .
author: Sarah Corker
BBC Look North

documents.title: sport : hull fc can end wigan 's unbeaten start to super league at the kc stadium
text: there 's a busy night ahead of super league with both our sides playing .
hull fc players hope to make up for last week 's home defeat by castleford by beating wigan .
the game sees scott taylor up against the club he left last year to join the black and whites , who he 'd always wanted to play for since he was a young boy .
it 's been a long journey but i always knew i wanted to be here one day and playing week in week out for hull .
now it 's a dream come true and there 's no one more happy to pull on a hull fc shirt than me . ''
commentaries : tonight on hull kr ( 95.9fm & online , 8pm ) , hull fc ( 1485am & online , 20:00 ) , grimsby town ( digital & online , 19:45 ) .
build-up from 18:00 .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: sport : willie poching takes temporary charge of hull kr again - but will it be his last ?
text: hull kr acting head coach willie poching says their game at widnes is n't a `` must win '' one .
that 's despite the fact that rovers are without a win in their opening four games .
the only must is to perform the best you can .
i 'd be disappointed if we did n't do that , if we did n't come up with the performance we 're capable of .
everybody 's got to perform to their potential , we have to do that as a group .
that 's the only must . ''
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: `` we 're staying put '' - mobile home residents refuse to leave a development near beverley
text: people living on a mobile home development near beverley say they 've no immediate plans to leave the site despite an enforcement notice which comes into force at midnight .

all of the homes on the lakeminster park development are supposed to be removed from the site by then after retrospective planning permission for people to live there all year-round at was refused by east riding council .
following appeals , the decision was upheld and residents were given 18 months from september 2014 to move out .
one group is pinning its hopes on the site owner getting planning permission for the homes on appeal .
david aldcroft says he 's staying in his home until there 's a definitive ruling :
i 'm hoping that some solution will be found that will satisfy us all without too much upheaval really .
ideally it would be wonderful if we won residency here which is a long shot .
i think the land owner is still in the hope that something along those lines will happen although its looking pretty gloomy at the moment . ''
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: work starts on £ 35m biomass plant near hull which is set to create new jobs
text: building work has started on the site of a £ 35m biomass plant in an east yorkshire village .
the plant near tansterne , will produce enough electricity to power 11,000 homes and is expected to open in 2017 .
mark wickham , managing director of hrs energy , which is building the plant , said the scheme could create up to 40 new jobs .
some villagers had objected to the development , which was granted final planning permission last month .
we tried everything within our power to stop it but unfortunately the council let it go ahead , so there is nothing we can do about it but live with it . ''

documents.title: clean-up for the queen gets underway in hull
text: people right across east yorkshire are taking up the challenge to `` clean for the queen '' .
in hull a team from tesco is one of 92 groups taking part across the city .
clare graham is the community manager at tesco in st stephens and doug sharp is from hull city council :
it 's part of a nationwide campaign to get volunteers to up litter and tidy up neighbourhoods in celebration of the queen 's 90th birthday .
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: uncertainty if bhs jobs will go in hull
text: bhs has announced it 's to cut 370 jobs across the uk .
around 8,500 people work for the company which said yesterday it needed to reduce the rent it pays for its shops .
it 's thought 150 of the jobs will go from it 's head office in london and 220 from stores around the country .
it 's not clear if any jobs at bhs in hull will be affected .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: aye up ! brid to get lessons in how to be nice to people
text: no-one could ever accuse yorkshire people of being blunt and speaking their minds .
but , just to smooth out any rough edges , officials are organising special courses for tourism businesses in bridlington .
the day-long events , focusing on customer care techniques , are designed to ensure first time visitors to bridlington next year receive the welcome they deserve .
author: Chris Arundel
Reporter, East Yorkshire

documents.title: siemens training centre launches today
text: i 've been down to see the new hull college training centre that 's opened in hull today .
people working at siemens wind turbine blade factory will get part of their training here .
all 800 operational staff hired to work at the factory will undergo five weeks of training at the new facility based on preston road .
here 's what the principal of hull college , graham towse told me :

its a huge statement from the point of view of the college in terms of our strategic intent to invest in this type of training but also i think its a huge statement to the people of hull that along with the companies that are investing here they 've got a local college here that is investing in them , investing in their skills and making sure that they will be skilled for those jobs that are here now and in the future . ''
author: James Piekos
Reporter, BBC Hull and East Yorkshire

documents.title: sport : hull city could lose out on automatic promotion place
text: hull city 's automatic promotion place is under threat tonight after their 1-0 defeat at birmingham city .
the tigers are vulnerable after losing to a deflected first-half goal at st andrews last night .
they hit the post and bar during the game but wasted a string of good chances to suffer their first defeat in six matches .
if rivals middlesbrough avoid defeat at home to wolves this evening , the tigers will drop to third .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: weather : risk of further showers this afternoon
text: there 's the risk of more wintry showers this afternoon .
temperatures will reach 5c ( 41f )
author: Kay Crewdson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: hull could get a gypsy moth - just not amy johnson 's gypsy moth
text: we 've been getting an update about the campaign to get hull aviator amy johnson 's plane back to the city .
mps from our area have been trying to get the gipsy moth plane , jason - which is currently at the london science museum - brought to the city .
but the museum says it would be too difficult to move it .
hull north mp diana johnson told me that after a meeting with the director , they 've now come to a compromise :
what we agreed was that he would look now at what he can do to help us perhaps get a different gypsy moth .

we ca n't have jason because its so difficult to move him but we might be able to get one that can come up to the city for the amy johnson festival and then perhaps leading into city of culture as well . ''
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: today 's hull daily mail
text: here 's a look at the front page of the hull daily mail :
author: Hull Daily Mail

documents.title: headlines : new biomass plant secures jobs in hull and compromise over amy johnson 's plane
text: headlines : new biomass plant secures jobs in hull and compromise over amy johnson 's plane
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: it 's looking wintry in bridlington
text: here 's a from our weather watcher kate j :
if you 've got any you want to send us you can email us , or post them on facebook or twitter .
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: bid to build new women 's centre in hull
text: a fundraising scheme to build a new women 's centre in hull is being launched .
the big purple build campaign aims to raise enough money to replace the preston road women 's centre with a bigger and better building .
it 's known locally as the 'purple house ' .
we 've outgrown the building we 're in on preston road with the growth of our services .
we 're virtually sitting on each other 's knees .
with help from the big lottery we 're hoping to move into a new building on the other side of preston road but we need to do some fundraising to add to that money from the big lottery . ''
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: biomass plant will power 11,000 homes
text: the boss of a new £ 35m biomass plant to be built in east yorkshire has been talking to bbc radio humberside about the project .
one hundred long-term manufacturing jobs are expected to be secured when hrs energy opens in tansterne near aldbrough .
i spoke to mark wickham , the managing director of hrs energy , who told me why they chose this particular site :
the plant will provide enough clean energy to power 11,000 homes .
but it 's not been welcomed by some people living nearby .
they 're concerned that the value of their houses will fall .
sandra bullas is one of them :
it will just be a big massive concrete block with a big tower on top .
not very nice to look at at all , there 'll be no nice views .
its destroyed everything , its devalued the property , everything . ''
author: Carl Wheatley
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: can you spot the snow ?
text: it is actually snowing here in hull ; a sleety sort of snow but its definitely snowing , you just ca n't see it on my
but here 's a much better of snow in our region , sent in by one of our weather watchers .
here 's helen 's view in kellington :
author: Gill Sennett
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: a yorkshire wide police force is 'inevitable '
text: a merged yorkshire police force is `` inevitable '' according to unison , the union which represents some police staff .
more and more services are already being shared between humberside and south yorkshire police .
if these cuts keep going , i think its inevitable .
i speak to my colleagues in west yorkshire , speak to my colleagues in north yorkshire and humberside and they 're of the same opinion .
i think at some stage within the next 10 years it will be a yorkshire force . ''

gary forsyth , the deputy chief constable for humberside police , says there is no prospect of any merger taking place and any decision to create a yorkshire-wide force would have to be decided on by the government .
you can see more on this story on sunday politics this weekend
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: cheers ! the rise of the micropub
text: there 's been a bit of a scare in recent years with warnings of rural pubs closing down and the death of the traditional freehouse .
but real ale is staging a fightback - this time in micropubs .
so what 's one of those ?
well , it 's everything a real pub should be , except it 's much smaller and usually set up in a disused building or room .
it serves beer from micro-breweries , and amplified music is banned in favour of good old banter with a just a handful of patrons and you 'll find them popping up all over the place .
on breakfast this morning we 're discussing micro-pubs
author: Chris Arundel
Reporter, East Yorkshire

documents.title: headlines : new plant will power 11,000 homes and north ferriby united 's up for sale
text: headlines : new plant will power 11,000 homes and north ferriby united 's up for sale
author: Natalie Glanvill
Reporter BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: sport : north ferriby united is up for sale
text: the owners of north ferriby united have put the club up for sale .
steve forster says he feels he can no longer invest time into the club whilst he recovers from his recent neurosurgery .
here 's a statement issued by joint owners steve and eman forster who have put the club up for sale with immediate effect .
club director julian wild says he 's been reassured that the club will continue as normal while they look for a buyer .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

text: its a cloudy , wet and cold start to the day .
highs of around 5c ( 41f ) .
here 's the full forecast :
